item.title: Measles alert issued for Gold Coast as Queensland cases climb
item.description: The highly infectious measles virus is detected on the Gold Coast, just a day after new cases in Far North Queensland.

item.title: Potato mop-top virus impossible to eradicate, Biosecurity Tasmania says as ninth incursion detected
item.description: Potato mop-top virus is here to stay and its source is unlikely to ever be discovered, Biosecurity Tasmania has said.

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Optus CEO apologises to customers impacted by major network outage
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Optus CEO confirms three deaths during network outage affecting emergency calls
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Perth childcare worker Robert David Reti found not guilty of indecently touching two young girls
item.description: A Perth childcare worker is found not guilty of indecently touching two girls, aged four and six, at two separate centres in 2023.

item.title: Optus makes another catastrophic mistake and three people are dead after letting customers down 'when they needed them most'
item.description: Optus made another catastrophic mistake, but this time three people are dead after the telecommunications giant let customers down "when they needed them most".

item.title: A secret lived in plain sight
item.description: Alliyah is reckoning with a decade of grooming and abuse at the hands of a trusted teacher.

item.title: What we know about the Optus outage which disrupted triple-zero calls, linked to three deaths
item.description: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

item.title: Israel faces pressure over Gaza ahead of General Assembly as United Nations confronts its own identity crisis
item.description: The UN's role in areas beyond diplomacy, such as in humanitarian aid and refugees, cultural heritage, health, and climate, are all under assault from savage budget cuts.

item.title: Sussan Ley and the Coalition face a ticking time bomb
item.description: The opposition leader survived a bruising post-election fight that left conservatives seething and has been left with no natural allies.

item.title: Climate risks report paints grim picture, but expert on societal collapse explains giving up is not the answer
item.description: Lethal heat, mosquito-borne viruses, mass displacement and conflict — we got a glimpse into a grim climate future. Can imagining the end of the world be good for us, or is it a path to apathy?

item.title: The inside story of an ABC report that helped scuttle Australia's biggest foreign takeover
item.description: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

item.title: Senator calls for 'heads on spikes' to deter superannuation mismanagement
item.description: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

item.title: Investigation of eye-maker's online presence reveals multiple red flags
item.description: A reverse-image search of ocularist Jack McDonald's website shows that receptionist "Nadia" also appears on a dentistry blog and is known as "Donna" on a self-help guru's site. It's just one of the red flags that ABC NEWS Verify spotted during its investigation.

item.title: Donald Trump's historic second state visit to the UK was filled with risks for Keir Starmer. Did it pay off?
item.description: Britain rolled the dice on an historic second state visit for the US president in a year of domestic and international political turmoil. It found out where its relationship with Washington was at.

item.title: Monash IVF pauses donor treatments in NSW as it conducts review of patient records
item.description: Patients have been left blindsided by Monash IVF's decision to temporarily halt treatments using donated eggs and sperm in New South Wales.

item.title: Collingwood and Brisbane meet again, two years on from classic 2023 grand final, for tantalising rematch
item.description: The 2023 grand final will go down as one of the best deciders in AFL history, and though the stakes are only marginally lower two years on, the numbers suggest Collingwood and Brisbane's 2025 preliminary final could be another classic.

item.title: Woman's snake bite death in Katherine sparks warnings against complacency
item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left
item.description: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

item.title: The contenders in the race to replace outgoing NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb
item.description: The looming decision on who will be the next NSW police commissioner may be one of the biggest of Chris Minns's tenure.

item.title: Judge throws out Donald Trump's multi-billion-dollar New York Times lawsuit
item.description: The US president's $US15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times has been labelled "improper" by a federal judge.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Simon Tayoun's been a devout member of the Green Army since he watched his first-ever game of rugby league in 1987, and now he's become an unofficial mascot by bringing his custom drum to every game he can to lead the Viking Clap.

item.title: Perth family endure cold, wet winter in bus amid worsening housing crisis
item.description: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

item.title: Storm damage sees shark net installation delay at Sydney's Shark Beach in Nielsen Park
item.description: Shark Beach in Sydney's east is seasonally netted with an enclosure to protect swimmers from sharks during Sydney's warmer months — but for the upcoming school holidays, it is unlikely the nets will be installed in time.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Tasmania's tree fern trade accused of 'greenwashing' over native forest logging links, but others say it is sustainable
item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.title: Chelsea FC Women's star Sam Kerr presented with special football to mark 100 goals for club
item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.title: Victor Caulfield moved to Florence in his 70s and became an artists' model
item.description: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

item.title: British couple freed from Afghanistan's Taliban
item.description: The couple, who ran a charity in Afghanistan where they had lived for 18 years, were freed after months of negotiations with the Taliban by Qatar in coordination with Britain.

item.title: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised
item.description: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

item.title: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner - ABC News
item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.title: Eucalypt trail named after botanist Dean Nicolle opens in SA
item.description: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

item.title: Kianga coal mine tragedy 50 years later and the reforms that followed
item.description: Half a century after the Kianga mine explosion killed 13 workers in central Queensland, a community gathers to remember the tragedy as survivors and experts raise fresh concerns about ongoing safety risks.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Wide Bay affordable housing estate scrapped due to 'unfeasible' costs
item.description: A controversial housing estate that would have been built on 26 hectares of Bundaberg's green space has been scrapped.

item.title: Canada beats New Zealand 34-19 to reach Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.title: Victorian apiarists finding it harder to access public land 'vital' for bees
item.description: Apiarists are concerned they are losing access to public land in Victoria that provides a critical food source for their hives.

item.title: Near-blinded police officer reunites with those who saved him after rural motorcycle crash
item.description: Police officer John Kenworthy returns to thank the first responders in Mackay, and others who were with him in his darkest moments, after a rural motorcycle crash.

item.title: Donald Trump says three 'narcoterrorists' killed in US strike on alleged drug boat
item.description: This is the third fatal strike the US military has carried out this month on a vessel allegedly carrying drugs.

item.title: Turtling tracking in Broome
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: World-first turtle tracking reveals secrets of flatback turtles in WA's Roebuck Bay
item.description: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

item.title: Meet the diehard fans powering the green machine
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canberra Raiders receive NRL semifinal blow, losing five-eighth Ethan Strange to illness
item.description: Canberra Raiders are forced to reshuffle their team on the morning of the semifinal against Cronulla after illness struck wunderkind Ethan Strange.

item.title: Teenager pleads guilty to manslaughter over Hobart waterfront drowning
item.description: Deepinderjeet Singh was sitting with a woman near Franklin Wharf in Hobart in late January 2024 when a 17-year-old boy pushed the pair into the water and stole the woman's handbag.

item.title: Critical incident declared after man dies during alleged DV arrest in Sydney's south west
item.description: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

item.title: UN says there's evidence organised crime scam centres are moving from South-East Asia into new frontier of the Pacific
item.description: As scam centres run by organised crime find it harder to operate in South-East Asia, evidence emerges of them moving into the Pacific and setting up lucrative operations estimated to net billions each year.

item.title: Kamala Harris's frustration with Joe Biden, and other takeaways from her election trail memoir
item.description: Kamala Harris has kept a low profile since losing the US election, but she has plenty to say in her upcoming book — a diary from her doomed campaign.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.title: Yolŋu people celebrate 50 years of the homelands movement in East Arnhem Land
item.description: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

item.title: Super Netball celebrates bumper year as Sunshine Coast Lightning drives registration surge
item.description: A Queensland community is reaping the rewards of establishing the first regional professional netball team in the national league.

item.title: Police officer allegedly tasered during arrest in Bathurst, NSW
item.description: A police officer has suffered minor injuries after allegedly being tasered while attempting to carry out an arrest in Bathurst, New South Wales.

item.title: From Jennifer Lopez to K-pop, meet the Australian backing artists helping superstars shine
item.description: Backup dancers and backing singers spend years perfecting their craft. But who are these artists and how does it feel performing in the shadows of superstars?

item.title: Minister slams 'extremist' candidates nominating for WA council elections
item.description: Local Government Minister Hannah Beazely condemns the emergence of "extremist" candidates nominating for the state's forthcoming council elections.

item.title: Trump will impose a $150,000 annual fee for H-1B visas. Here's what it means
item.description: Some hope this visa price hike will see the US tech industry prioritise American workers. Others argue it'll dissuade the "world's smartest talent" from choosing to work in the US.

item.title: Kangaroos beat Blues for 18th straight AFLW win as Cats, Hawks and Dockers triumph
item.description: Reigning premiers North Melbourne thrashes Carlton by 53 points, while Port Adelaide is stunned by an umpiring decision in its narrow loss to Geelong.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Brisbane defeats Collingwood by 29 points to advance to third-straight AFL grand final
item.description: A training session on Saturday morning featuring speed work adds to Lachie Neale's optimism about returning for Brisbane in the AFL grand final after the Lions beat the Magpies.

item.title: Sharks and Knights reach NRLW preliminary finals
item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: NRL finals updates: Cronulla Sharks defeat Canberra Raiders 32-12 in semifinal
item.description: An out-of-place nose doesn't hurt Joe Tapine as much as Canberra's NRL finals exit, but he hopes the pain of defeat will drive them to greater things next year.

item.title: Queensland's measles outbreak growing after case confirmed in rural town Middlemount
item.description: A rural town in central Queensland is the latest community affected, after a case was recorded in Middlemount.

item.title: Republicans seize on Charlie Kirk's death to crack down on liberal dissent that puts freedom of speech 'in peril'
item.description: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

item.title: What is 'Solastalgia' and how are climate-affected communities tackling it?
item.description: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

item.title: Asia's protests grew from social media where misinformation also spread
item.description: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: Antinatalists say human suffering, and climate change, makes having children unethical. Are they right?
item.description: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

item.title: What makes China confident enough to ban microchips made by US firm Nvidia?
item.description: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will meet Donald Trump next week as Russia intensifies attacks
item.description: The Ukrainian president says he will hold "a meeting with the President of the United States" to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: 'We should kill him': AI chatbot encourages Australian man to murder his father
item.description: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

item.title: The Duchess of Kent renounced her title in 2002 and never looked back
item.description: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

item.title: When is Charlie Kirk's memorial service? How to watch it in Australia
item.description: A public memorial service will be held for the late political commentator at a stadium in the US state of Arizona.

item.title: Whale charity boss Brett Taylor allegedly ran euthanasia body 'discovery service'
item.description: Court documents allege a 53-year-old Queensland man ran a fake whale euthanasia charity to traffic assisted suicide drugs.

item.title: Scrubs is getting a reboot just in time for the hospital procedural revival
item.description: In a sea of hospital-based TV, long-running sitcoms Scrubs is often highlighted as one of the most realistic options. Now the reboot has been confirmed, and off the back of The Pitt’s big Emmy wins, we look back at the beloved show.

item.title: Chronic pain makes life hell for kids, but it's impacting work productivity as well
item.description: Chronic pain has devastating effects on those who suffer from it, including children, but it has wider impacts and they are costing Australia billions, a survey has found.

item.title: Jacinta Allan charts her own path with China in five-day tour of networking, photo ops and pandas
item.description: Premier Jacinta Allan has completed a tour of five Chinese cities where she has attempted to set the tone for future trade, boost Chinese international student numbers and promote her Suburban Rail Loop project.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Jay MacAskill and his daughters — Skylah and Ava — are building a strong bond over a new found love of skateboarding.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Tough times in Wagga Wagga as young tennis stars chase grand slam dreams
item.description: Cara Korhonen played on Rod Laver Arena when she was 10 years of age and is putting her blood, sweat and tears into setting foot on there again.

item.title: Canadian teenage golfer Anna Huang leads the La Sella Open by three shots after 54 holes
item.description: Canadian golf sensation Anna Huang, 16, is on the brink of making history, holding a three-shot lead going into the final round of a Ladies European Tour event in Spain.

item.title: Addressing Australia's housing crisis is a mammoth task. Is making housing a human right the answer?
item.description: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

item.title: Republicans warn Anthony Albanese of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition
item.description: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

item.title: SA Liberals' star candidate in spotlight after AI algal bloom 'admin error'
item.description: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

item.title: Women celebrate vintage glam, self-love and healthy body image with pin-up
item.description: Women are embracing modern pin-up culture as a way to express confidence and joy in their own skin.

item.title: The Adelaide Crows have been the powerhouse of the AFLW. Now they are being challenged
item.description: The AFLW's rapid evolution has been a double-edged sword for Adelaide, which is the most successful club in competition history, having won three of the eight premierships.

item.title: Man charged after police say they found $1 million in a cardboard box in his vehicle
item.description: Police say they were conducting a random breath test when they came across the cardboard box full of cash.

item.title: Man formally charged with murdering TikTok influencer Sana Yousaf in Pakistan
item.description: A Pakistani court charges a 22-year-old man with murder for shooting a teenage social media influencer, Sana Yousaf, after refusing his offer of friendship.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Cockchafer worm wreaking havoc on West Australian grain crops
item.description: Growers and scientists have teamed up in a bid to combat the rapidly increasing population of the voracious pest, which is devastating crops in WA's south-east.

item.title: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90 per cent
item.description: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

item.title: Symbio Wildlife Park emu chicks being raised by hens after father walks out
item.description: Birds of a different feather are flocking together at a wildlife park in New South Wales, where the chickens have been given the responsibility of being foster parents to a pair of abandoned emu chicks.

item.title: White House says the new $100k H-1B visa fee won't apply to existing holders
item.description: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
item.description: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

item.title: Crocodiles on the move in northern Australia as breeding season arrives
item.description: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: How Brisbane, Hawthorn, Geelong and Collingwood stay on top of the AFL world
item.description: The 21st century has been dominated by four AFL clubs — Geelong, Hawthorn, Collingwood and Brisbane — but there's no single secret to their success.

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Explaining Aussie driving culture to make roads safer for recent arrivals
item.description: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: Demons defeat Eagles as Crows, Giants, Lions and Saints score AFLW wins
item.description: The Demons' Eden Zanker enjoys a day out with five goals to help defeat Daisy Pearce's young Eagles squad by 51 points, while the Crows launch a final-quarter fightback to get past the Suns.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: Optus CEO confirms further customer report calls, service outage at NSW-SA border.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dayne Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Mason Cox's glasses in Lions' win over Magpies
item.description: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri crashes on lap one, Max Verstappen wins in Baku
item.description: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

item.title: Penrith's win over Canterbury was a reminder there is no team like them
item.description: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

item.title: Nicola Olyslagers wins high jump gold, Ky Robinson comes fourth in 5,000m on rain-hit final day of World Athletics Championships
item.description: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

item.title: Is artificial intelligence overhyped or is AI the 'fourth industrial revolution'?
item.description: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

item.title: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for basic care at home under aged care changes
item.description: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

item.title: Gene editing is being sold on the promise of healthier babies — but what are the ethical concerns?
item.description: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it is still deeply controversial.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025 — when is it, how to watch and who are the favourites for AFL's best-and-fairest award
item.description: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: Sarah Kopp's teacher Paul Grealy groomed her at 15. As an adult, she held him to account
item.description: Sarah Kopp's life was up-ended when a charismatic teacher twice her age started grooming her. Then they married and had children. When she sought justice 20 years on, she faced an impossible choice.

item.title: In an Australian first, chip company recycles leftover cooking oil into packaging to reduce emissions
item.description: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips — but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

item.title: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Donald Trump says
item.description: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

item.title: Eleanor Patterson's 'bittersweet' moment of support for young rival at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina Topić through a tough moment, she gained so much more.

item.title: Dementia-linked protein lower in people reporting vigorous exercise, study finds
item.description: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Charlie Kirk a 'martyr' at memorial service, widow Erika Kirk forgives alleged assassin
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a "martyr to American freedom", while his widow says she forgives his alleged assassin during a memorial to the right-wing activist.

item.title: Australia has been free of endemic measles since 2014. Could that change?
item.description: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australia — the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

item.title: Pensioners left 'waiting to die' in regional Victoria as specialist healthcare costs rise
item.description: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

item.title: BOM forecasts sunny skies ahead for Queensland school holidays
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says the weather will be as good as people in the Sunshine State can hope for at this time of year, with another wet summer on the horizon.

item.title: Murray River flood may not be to blame for SA algal bloom, Senate inquiry hears
item.description: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

item.title: Tinder, Hinge ban for man convicted of possessing child abuse material welcomed by child safety advocate
item.description: A child safety advocate welcomes a recent decision to uphold a ban on a convicted child sex offender from two dating apps, which comes after the man tried to have the ban overturned.

item.title: Sydney underworld lawyer challenging police warrant over drug supply, guns claims
item.description: NSW Police issued a warrant for solicitor Abdul Saddik's devices earlier this year as part of a probe into his links to figures in Sydney's underworld.

item.title: Storm-damaged turbine at NSW Central West wind farm raises safety concerns
item.description: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW National Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

item.title: Short-term stays are swallowing up housing stock in these WA coastal havens
item.description: With one of the nation's highest proportions of Airbnbs, some of WA's most popular tourist towns face a dilemma. Tourism is their biggest breadwinner — but with a housing crisis in full swing, short-term stays are pushing more and more locals away.

item.title: RBA says economy in cyclical upturn, ASX gains after record close on Wall Street — as it happened
item.description: RBA delivers upbeat economic assessment to parliament, but warns about the risks of a Chinese slowdown.

item.title: Sam Kerr earns a standing ovation in home game return as Chelsea defeats Leicester 1-0 in WSL
item.description: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

item.title: Worker dies after being struck by forklift in Sydney's east
item.description: The 57-year-old man was at a worksite in Sydney's east when he was seriously injured by a forklift.

item.title: Australian Jay Vine wins men's time trial silver in the world road cycling championships in Rwanda
item.description: Queenslander Jay Vine races to a silver medal in the men's time trial at the world road cycling championships in Rwanda.

item.title: This program could be the blueprint for helping kids fleeing domestic violence stay off the streets
item.description: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

item.title: NT police data shows violent crime increasing, property crime decreasing
item.description: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

item.title: Protesters in Philippines clash with police in rallies against corruption
item.description: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

item.title: Police charge woman with allegedly defrauding four elderly residents at aged care facility where she worked
item.description: Police allege the woman defrauded four elderly residents at an aged care facility where she worked and used their bank details to make personal purchases.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: Germany sends planes to track Russian military aircraft as Trump vows to defend Baltic states
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will defend the Baltic states if Russia intensifies hostilities following Moscow's incursion into Estonia's airspace in recent days.

item.title: Queensland CHO on state's measles outbreak
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Matt Denny finishes fourth in farcical discus competition at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Matt Denny was one discus thrower who ended up slipping and sliding across the Tokyo National Stadium as heavy rain made the discus competition a farce.

item.title: Man charged with murder of Queensland mother Crystal Beale, whose body was found in the Brisbane River
item.description: Ms Beale's body was found in the Brisbane River by a member of the public in the early hours of February 22.

item.title: Jacqui Lambie calls on independent MLCs to 'block' the proposed Macquarie Point stadium
item.description: Senator Jacqui Lambie tells the independents in Tasmania's upper house — who hold the fate of the Macquarie Point stadium in their hands — to "find the courage the premier can't" and stop the project.

item.title: Aussie brothers Jett and Hunter Lawrence win at SuperMotocross World Championship
item.description: Two brothers from the Sunshine Coast finish first and second in the SuperMotocross World Championship, taking home an eye-watering cash reward.

item.title: Australians can't trust the triple-0 network after 13-hour Optus outage results in deaths
item.description: The Optus failure is shocking and no doubt a massive fine and other sanctions could be on the way, but experts say it raises further questions.

item.title: 'Turning it up to eleven': Spinal Tap returns
item.description: The new film follows the fictional heavy metal band reuniting for one final gig with cameos from Elton John and Paul McCartney.

item.title: Easy and healthy dinner recipes for spring
item.description: If you're looking for light dinner ideas as the weather warms up, we have plenty of easy options. Think veggie-filled frittatas and beef taco bowls with a few healthy swaps.

item.title: Shalom House drug rehab centre CEO Peter Lyndon-James to step down over immigration views
item.description: The head of a controversial WA drug rehabilitation service says he will resign so he can speak out against "mass migration".

item.title: Two men charged after alleged assault of referees following junior rugby grand final in Canberra
item.description: Two men have been charged with assault after an alleged coward punch attack during a junior rugby sevens grand final on Sunday in which a referee was knocked unconscious.

item.title: NT Police complete Kumanjayi White death in custody autopsy, with brief of evidence handed to prosecutors
item.description: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody in Alice Springs has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges should be laid.

item.title: Australian pair Holly Harris and Jason Chan qualify for ice dance at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Australian pair Holly Harris and Jason Chan finish second at the Skate to Milano event in Beijing to book their spot at the Milan-Cortina Olympic Games in February next year.

item.title: Gold Coast man sentenced over former partner's traumatic brain injury
item.description: A man is sentenced over a 2023 incident in which his former partner jumped from a moving car to escape him, leaving her with a traumatic brain injury.

item.title: Is AI impacting your career or life plans? Has its rapid rise got you rethinking your future? The ABC wants to hear from you
item.description: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC want to hear from you.

item.title: West Swan's Pow Street residents demand water pipes be replaced after 'massive' leaks
item.description: Residents of a street in the Perth's outskirts say they are desperate after six water main bursts in the past 20 years, but the Water Corp says the pipes are only 52 years old and well within their life span.

item.title: Masood Zakaria asks court to permanently stay his murder trial over 'unlawful' deportation from Türkiye
item.description: A major Sydney murder trial is at risk of falling over as a Supreme Court judge ruled there was evidence the man charged was deported back to Australia unlawfully.

item.title: 'It is do-able': How interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown plans to balance ANU's expenditure and revenue
item.description: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive ABC interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

item.title: Court hears details of final hours of murdered children as Hakyung Lee murder trial nears end
item.description: Hakyung Lee admits killing her children but claims she is not guilty by reason of insanity.

item.title: Nasal spray flu vaccine becomes available for young SA children next year
item.description: Three-year-old Clive has a brain injury after contracting influenza B. His mother is urging others to be immunised as SA announces it will make a nasal spray vaccination available to young children next year.

item.title: Geelong star Max Holmes admits missing 2022 grand final hurt relationship with coach Chris Scott
item.description: Geelong speedster Max Holmes is desperate to put his previous grand-final week anger and heartbreak behind him as the Cats eye AFL premiership glory.

item.title: How the ANU's interim leader wants to turn its reputation around
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: From Donald Trump's speech to Erika Kirk's forgiveness: What you missed at the Charlie Kirk memorial
item.description: From Donald Trump's wide-ranging speech to a potential reunion between former foes, here are the main takeaways from Charlie Kirk's memorial service in Arizona.

item.title: Hunter woman claims self-defence over fatal stabbing during street fight
item.description: Hunter woman Lily Ridgeway pleads not guilty to manslaughter over the stabbing death of Jason Adams at Raymond Terrace in 2020, claiming she acted in self-defence.

item.title: Super Netball's Sunshine Coast Lightning enters new Global Sports Fund Management Group ownership
item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.title: New hospital a 'jewel in the crown' as premier acknowledges Western Sydney health failures
item.description: Premier Chris MInns vows to make Western Sydney hospitals a "hell of a lot better," saying the current offering "hasn't been good enough."

item.title: Three alleged kidnappers denied bail after 'hostage situation' in front of kids
item.description: Three alleged kidnappers were trying to recover a $200,000 debt from a 52-year-old man in Monash on September 21, a court has heard, while rejecting their bail application.

item.title: Paper Australia sues Victorian government for $402 million over timber supply failure
item.description: Paper Australia alleges the state government failed to provide enough raw materials for its Maryvale mill, causing substantial loss and damage.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos undecided on halves combination ahead of prelim final against Penrith
item.description: Brisbane coach Michael Maguire continues to experiment with his halves combinations on Monday as Ezra Mam takes another key step towards a return from injury.

item.title: Alexander O'Sachy faces Brisbane court charged with manslaughter of Angela Godwin
item.description: The court heard the 47-year-old had a criminal history spanning more than 20 years for more than 50 offences, including the unlawful wounding of a former partner in 2008.

item.title: Potato mop-top virus detected in Victoria for first time, industry says
item.description: The infected potato seeds, transported from Tasmania to Victoria, were found in cold storage and none have been planted.

item.title: Endangered Littlejohn's tree frog finally bred in captivity amid habitat threat
item.description: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in their work to save the Littlejohn's tree frog species which only exists in three isolated regions in New South Wales.

item.title: Labor reaffirms support for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium, in wake of Planning Commission report
item.description: Tasmanian Labor has reaffirmed its support for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium, despite being "deeply concerned" about cost blowouts — and says the "power" of having a state team in the AFL "cannot be underestimated".

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025: All the best fashion looks from AFL's night of nights
item.description: Just after the fashion from this evening's Brownlow Medal? We've got you.

item.title: Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal as Gold Coast star beats out Nick Daicos and Bailey Smith
item.description: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call regarding Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaves the room stunned.

item.title: Bathurst childcare worker charged over alleged common assault of 4yo
item.description: Police allege the 18-year-old educator dragged a four-year-old boy by the arm and threw him on a mattress at a childcare centre in Bathurst earlier this year.

item.title: WA Education Minister Sabine Winton rejects claims large workload behind high teacher resignations
item.description: WA’s education minister rejects claims a record number of teachers quitting their jobs is due to them being overworked.

item.title: Leopard sharks recorded mating by researcher in rare event off New Caledonia
item.description: A Sunshine Coast marine biologist has captured unique footage of two male sharks mating with a female in waters off New Caledonia.

item.title: David Jenkins murder trial hears from co-accused who says he was unaware victim had been stabbed
item.description: A Tasmanian man on trial for murder has told a court he "attacked" and swore at his brother, after learning his younger sibling had allegedly stabbed a man who later died.

item.title: Qantas suspends Hong Kong flights for 36 hours as hub braces for super Typhoon Ragasa
item.description: Qantas suspends all flights to Hong Kong for 36 hours from Tuesday evening as the financial hub prepares for Typhoon Ragasa, one of its strongest super typhoons in years.

item.title: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock concerned about future of UN and funding
item.description: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock fears for the organisation's future as she seeks a resolution in Gaza and on funding.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Non-profit multiple sclerosis organisation MS Society SA & NT in voluntary administration
item.description: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

item.title: Kimberley carer jailed for impregnating child and indecently dealing with another
item.description: A Kimberley man is sentenced to more than six years' jail for raping a child under 13 and indecently dealing with another.

item.title: More than $4 million in drugs seized across WA's far north in ongoing operation
item.description: Police in the Kimberley say an ongoing investigation has seized millions of dollars' worth of methylamphetamine, ammunition and other drugs.

item.title: Woman in critical condition after being hit by train in Adelaide
item.description: A 61-year-old woman from Adelaide's southern suburbs is in hospital with life-threatening injuries after she was hit by a train.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has written to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Russia reviving Soviet-style coercive psychiatry measures to quash dissent, says UN expert
item.description: The UN's special rapporteur on rights in Russia says the Kremlin is resorting to coercive psychiatry measures to suppress anti-war dissidents.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Multiple UK charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The decisions came after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

item.title: NATO members slam Russia for territorial incursions at UN session
item.description: Allies say they will not hesitate to shoot down Russian jets which violate NATO airspace in future siutations, after two jets entered Estonia's skies last week.
